column4: stole a nearby public desktop -- switching to ubuntu on my t430
lsusb gives pastebin.com/STFmbR7B
ok, please do this next: lspci -knn | grep -iA3 Wireless | pastebinit
s/Wireless/Wifi? the former doesn't give me anything
and Wifi would give results? then do that, please
this should work, too: lspci -knnv | grep -iA7 network | pastebinit
yeah I get an entry for Wifi: (internet died so copying manually): Realtek Semiconductor Co., Ltd. RTL8188CE 802.11b/g/n Wifi Adapter [10ec:8176] (rev 01)   [cont'd...]
[..cont'd] Subsystem: Realtek Semidoncutor Co., Ltd. Device [10ec:8195] ...
... Kernel driver in use: rtl8192ce ...
... Kernel modules: rtl8192ce
and you're using which ubuntu version?
does this give something? lsmod | grep rtl
yup. what were you looking for in particular?
the left column hs rtl8..., rtl8..._common, rtlwifi, mac20122, cfg80211
i'm trying to find out which driver is in use. the rtl8... ones are of interest
rtl8192c_common 75767 1 rtl8192ce
that's enough, thanks. give me a minute.
dpkg -l linux-firmware | grep ^.i
ii linux-firmware 1.79 \n Firmware for linux kernel drivers

so you have the firmware blobs installed already but they don't help, or not enough. it looks like your very model is not well supported. let's see if i can find a newer version of the driver and firmware.
I've actually got to run now (class) -- I'll try and get on later though and bother you again (or someone else if you're not around)
